message.content:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: 
```java
import java.io.*;
import java.util.StringTokenizer;

public class p02gpa {
    public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {
        String file = "p02-grades.txt";
        BufferedReader br = new BufferedReader(new FileReader(file));
        String rec;
        System.out.println("    Name               GPA  Classes        Hours/Grades");
        System.out.println("    ------------------ ---- -------- ------------------------ ");
        while((rec=br.readLine())!= null)
            calcDisp(rec);
        br.close();
    }

    public static void calcDisp(String rec) {
        StringTokenizer tok;
        String name;
        String fname;
        String lname;
        double ptValue = 0.0;
        double qualtyPts = 0.0;
        double hours = 0.0;
        double gpa = 0.0;
        int ctr=0;
        tok = new StringTokenizer(rec,",/");
        lname = tok.nextToken();
        fname = tok.nextToken();
        name = fname+ " "+lname;
        System.out.println(name);
        ctr++;
        while(tok.hasMoreTokens()) {
            String hrsStr = tok.nextToken();
            hours = Double.parseDouble(hrsStr);
            String letterGrade = tok.nextToken();
            switch (letterGrade) {
                case "A":
                    ptValue = 4.0;
                    break;
                case "B":
                    ptValue = 3.0;
                    break;
                case "C":
                    ptValue = 2.0;
                    break;
                case "D":
                    ptValue = 1.0;
                    break;
                case "F":
                    ptValue = 0.0;
                    break;
            }
            qualtyPts += ptValue * hours;
        }
        gpa = qualtyPts / (ctr * hours);
        System.out.printf("GPA: %.2f\n", gpa);
    }
}
```
<<<explanation>>>: The StringTokenizer.nextToken API is used to break the string into tokens. In this code, it is used to separate the different parts of the record (last name, first name, hours, and grades). The tokens are then processed to calculate the GPA. The GPA is calculated by multiplying the point value of the grade by the number of hours, summing these for all classes, and then dividing by the total number of hours. The switch statement is used to assign the correct point value to each grade. The result is then printed out.
